responses: Hi there, what can I do for you?
Hi there, how can I help?
See you later, thanks for visiting
Try cooling all burns with tepid to cool water
Do not apply ice, ointments, butter or other 'home remedies'

Apply an ointment such as petroleum jelly to the blister and cover it with a nonstick gauze bandage. 
If a rash appears, stop using the ointment. Follow-up care. Check the area every day for infection.

Try, 
https://www.google.com/url?sa=t&rct=j&q=&esrc=s&source=web&cd=&cad=rja&uact=8&ved=2ahUKEwj384uGybj0AhW26XMBHYYxDJ0QFnoECBcQAQ&url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.skinsight.com%2Fskin-conditions%2Ffirst-aid%2Ffirst-aid-blisters&usg=AOvVaw2WQ-yHBrvWWCw6TFNhqmt3 
for more information on blisters.

Rest the bruised area, if possible.
Ice the bruise with an ice pack wrapped in a towel.
Leave it in place for 10 to 20 minutes.
Repeat several times a day for a day or two as needed.
Compress the bruised area if it is swelling, using an elastic bandage. Don't make it too tight.
Elevate the injured area.

Try, 
https://www.skinsight.com/skin-conditions/first-aid/first-aid-bruises 
for more information on blisters.
